text: Boy: I’m scared. How do we get out of here? I don’t want to die.
You: We’re already dead. It’s not so bad, is it?
Boy: I’d rather be alive. Wouldn’t you?
Boy: I don’t like it when adults lie to me.
Boy: Wouldn’t you rather be alive? Tell the truth this time.
Boy: Hey… have you seen my mother? In this place?
Boy: Good. I’m glad she’s not here.
You: I think it’s just us.
Boy: I guess that’s good. Lonely, but good. Right? It’s good that it’s just us?
You: Yeah. It’s good. It’s nice and quiet, huh?
Boy: Very quiet. Except when you’re talking.
You: Hey. I’m gonna go now. I need to do one last thing. I’m coming back.
